New Records: F. Ioannidis scored a brace for Greece in the match, marking his first multi-goal game in over a year.
B. Källman scored an own goal, marking his first goal in international football since 2022.
Key Match Events: F. Ioannidis opened the scoring with a goal in the 23rd minute.
B. Källman scored an own goal in the 37th minute, giving Greece a 2-0 lead at halftime.
F. Ioannidis scored again in the 76th minute to extend Greece's lead.
Finland's goalkeeper made three crucial saves to keep the score 3-0.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was Greece's first game after a disappointing run in the Euro 2024 tournament, with expectations for a stronger performance.
Finland entered the match with a positive record in the Nations League but faced an aggressive Greek attack early on.
Post-Match Reflections: Greece's manager praised the team's resilience and attacking efficiency after the victory.
Finland's players expressed frustration with their defensive lapses and the inability to score.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a lively home crowd of 17,293 fans at Stadio Georgios Karaiskáki.
The game saw a total of 15 shots, with Greece converting 5 on target and Finland only 1.
Others: The match was part of Group 2 in League B of the UEFA Nations League, with Greece aiming to improve their standings after a poor Euro 2024 showing.
